intro: Eriogonum cronquistii, commonly known as the Cronquist's buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It produces bright yellow blooms in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
